definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)

sentences.english: Streets ain't gonna be ready for us this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年的“街舞爭鋒”也贏定了。

sentences.english: Forget about the deep meaning and messages in the words, let's talk about who's getting the blade.
sentences.chinese: 別管文字中的深刻含義和信息，讓我們談談誰與爭鋒。

sentences.english: First meteor hometown and margins and with stars.
sentences.chinese: 流星爭鋒故鄉還有緣以及披星。

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
